Second Section
Knowledge

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, so I have heard:

original: “Avijjā, bhikkhave, pubbaṅgamā akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā anvadeva ahirikaṁ anottappaṁ;
analyzed: avijjā bhikkhave pubbaṅgamā akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā ahirikam anottappa
translated: “Ignorance, monks, is the forerunner in the entry upon unwholesome states, with a lack of shame and a lack of fear of wrongdoing following along.

original: vijjā ca kho, bhikkhave, pubbaṅgamā kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā anvadeva hirottappan”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: vijjā ca kho bhikkhave pubbaṅgamā kusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā hirā uttappanti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: But, monks, knowledge is the forerunner in the entry upon wholesome states, with shame and a dread of wrongdoing following along.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in reference to this, it was said:
“Whatever bad destinations there are
in this world or the next,
All have ignorance as their root,
with craving and grasping as their basis.
But when a person is evil-minded,
shameless and disrespectful,
then he produces evil,
and because of that he goes to a bad destination.
Therefore, having given up desire and greed,
and having dispelled ignorance,
a monk who has aroused knowledge
shuns all bad destinations.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti  tatiya
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.🔽The third section on “as it was said” is finished.
The first recitation section.
